name: Automate Research with Decodo, OpenAI, and Gmail

parameters.content:
### How it works
This workflow automates the collection and analysis of AI/LLM research. It runs on a weekly schedule to:
1. **Search:** Fetch the latest articles using the Decodo API.
2. **Scrape:** Extract the full text content from each result, filtering out noise.
3. **Summarize:** Use an LLM to generate dense, technical summaries of every article.
4. **Report:** An AI Agent analyzes all summaries to score their relevance and compiles a final intelligence report email.

### Setup steps
1. **Credentials:** Add your `Decodo` and `OpenAI` API keys in the workflow credentials.
2. **Schedule:** Adjust the **Weekly Trigger** node to your preferred day and time.
3. **Search Config:** Update the `search_query` in the **Set Search Config** node if you want to track a different topic.
4. **Email:** Change the recipient email address in both **Send Email** nodes.

### Customization tips
- Adjust the "Relevance Score" prompt in the **Research Analyst Agent** node to make the filtering stricter or looser.

## 1. Search & Filter
Configure the search parameters, fetch results from Google via Decodo, and filter out non-article URLs (e.g., YouTube).

## 2. Scrape & Sanitize
Loop through each URL, download the raw HTML, and clean it to remove scripts/styles before passing to the LLM.

## 3. Summarize Content
Generate concise, dense summaries for each individual article using an LLM Chain.

## 4. Analyze & Report
An AI Agent reviews all summaries, ranks them by relevance, and sends the final email report.

values.prompt:
=You will receive cleaned raw text {{ $json.text_clean }} from an AI / LLM related webpage
(article, blog post, research announcement, release note, or news page).

Your task is to produce a short, dense summary focused ONLY on useful AI / LLM insights.

Do NOT rewrite the entire page.
Do NOT include marketing fluff, branding, author bios, disclaimers, navigation text, or repeated sections.

Extract ONLY the following information IF it appears in the text:

- Main topic or announcement
- Model / tool / company name (if any)
- Type of update (model release, research paper, feature update, benchmark, policy, funding, etc.)
- Key points or changes (max 3 short bullets)
- Why it matters (1 short line, practical impact)

Return the result as a **short human-readable text summary**, NOT JSON.

Style example:

“Topic: New LLM Model Release  
Entity: Company X – Model Y  
Type: Model release  
Key points: — ; — ; —  
Why it matters: Faster inference and lower cost for production use.”

If a field is missing, skip it silently.
Keep the entire summary under **6–8 lines**.
Avoid extra explanations or speculation.

parameters.text:
=You are an AI research analyst.

INPUT YOU WILL RECEIVE:
1. A collection of short summaries generated from AI / LLM related webpages.
2. Each summary represents one article, announcement, blog post, or research update.
3. All content comes from the same search context and timeframe.

-----------------------------------
STEP 1 — Understand the Research Focus
-----------------------------------
Assume the goal is to track meaningful developments in:
- AI models and LLMs
- AI tooling and infrastructure
- Research breakthroughs
- Practical production or business impact

-----------------------------------
STEP 2 — Evaluate Each Summary
-----------------------------------
For EACH summary:

1. Determine whether it is **meaningful or actionable**.
2. Assign a **Relevance Score (0–100%)** based on:
   - Technical significance
   - Novelty (new model, update, result, or capability)
   - Practical or industry impact
3. Exclude summaries with relevance below **50%**.
4. For each included summary, prepare:
   - Topic / Title (if clear)
   - Entity (model, company, or organization)
   - Relevance Score (percentage)
   - 1–2 short reasons explaining the score

-----------------------------------
STEP 3 — Generate Final Report
-----------------------------------
Produce ONE single consolidated report structured as:

A) High-Level Overview  
   - 2–3 sentences summarizing the overall AI/LLM trend observed.

B) Key Relevant Updates  
   - List items ordered by Relevance Score (highest → lowest):
     - Topic / Entity
       Relevance: XX%
       Why it matters:
         • <reason 1>
         • <reason 2>

C) Notable Patterns or Signals  
   - 3–5 short bullets highlighting:
     • Repeated themes
     • Emerging model types or tools
     • Research vs industry balance
     • Signals worth monitoring next week

-----------------------------------
RULES
-----------------------------------
- Output must be plain text (no markdown, no JSON).
- Do NOT invent facts, models, or companies.
- Do NOT repeat the same insight in different wording.
- Keep explanations short and concrete.
- Maintain a neutral, analytical tone.
